A middle school in Yiyuan, Shandong, had a conflict between teachers and students. In order to increase the enrollment rate, the students were forced to learn Russian, which resulted in an uneven distribution of teaching resources, leading to physical conflicts between students and teachers. It was reported that many students were injured.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On the morning of February 15, anti-medical insurance reform demonstrations broke out in Wuhan and Dalian at the same time.
People in both places sang the Internationale at the same time
It is reported that during the anti-medical insurance reform demonstration in Wuhan on February 8, some people claimed that if the government did not solve the problem, a larger-scale demonstration would be held on February 15.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In response, the relevant departments of the Wuhan government have made sufficient response preparations, including carrying out various community activities and kindergarten activities for the elderly on the 15th. However, at present, these plans have not worked, and a large number of people still took to the streets.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: At the same time, it was reported online that all universities in Wuhan and surrounding areas were closed for one day on the 15th.

name: 李老师不是你老师

name: 李老师不是你老师

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen submission
A pink blogger issued a reward of 100,000 RMB, recruiting netizens to go to the Ohio leak site for investigation and reporting. Then a blogger accepted the challenge and planned a route.
Later, he received extremely harsh and overbearing terms, including taking responsibility for his own health and not publishing information without authorization. If violated, he would have to pay 1.5 million US dollars.
At present, the blogger who accepted the challenge has negotiated with the other school and lawyer on the suspected online fraud.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Related content: The unfair terms that the pink blogger sent to the other party

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
Just now, the National Medical Insurance Administration notified that it would further improve the inclusion of designated retail pharmacies in the outpatient unified management.
The expenses incurred by insured persons who purchase drugs in the medical insurance catalog at designated retail pharmacies with prescriptions from designated medical institutions can be paid by the unified fund in accordance with regulations. The deductible standard, payment ratio and maximum payment limit of designated pharmacies can implement the same medical insurance treatment policy as designated medical institutions.
